turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Capital (sidewheeler).
turn.2: Capital (sidewheeler)  Capital, a famous side-wheel steamboat that ran between Sacramento and San Francisco from 1866 to 1896.
turn.4: "Capital" was built in San Francisco, by shipbuilder John Gunder North in his shipyard in the Potrero District.
turn.6: Launched in 1866, it was a 277 feet long, 1,989 ton, side-wheel paddle steamer.
turn.8: "Capital", was the largest of the steamboats on the rivers in California and the last side-wheel steamer built for the California Steam Navigation Company for the run between Sacramento and San Francisco until it was put to use as a ferry by the railroad between Oakland and San Francisco in July 1876.
turn.10: It remained on the water under various owners until it was broken up 1896.
